Description: Fragment of rim and wall of East Greek black-figured pottery bowl. Inside glazed with friezes in added colour of tongues, diamonds and bands; outside, band of tongues at rim; two friezes below, separated by band; above, lion, head turned back, confronting griffin, whose front right paw rests on lion's head; below, part of two swans, to right; blob rosette filling ornament; some added red on animals.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1146)
Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p.23, no.76, pl. 22)
Edgar 1911 / Catalogue Générale des antiquités égyptiennes du musée du Caire, Greek Vases (pl. 2)
